Parsons MPS Communication Design Digital Product Design

  • Curriculum

  • Faculty

  • Students

  • Apply

Faculty

The program is tailored to practicing designers seeking to enhance their digital skills and leadership potential as well as professionals with relevant design experience who want to enter the field. It encompasses the full product development cycle in communication design — from idea conception to prototyping to feedback-based refinements — and familiarizes you with business strategy.

Brendan Griffiths

 

Brendan Griffiths is a graphic designer, programmer, and educator living and working in New York City. He is a partner in the design practice Zut Alors!, and currently serves as Assistant Professor of Interaction Design at Parsons School of Design, where he directs the Master of Professional Studies in Communication Design.

He holds a BFA in Multimedia Design from the University of Oregon and an MFA in Graphic Design from Yale University.

Website

Adam Brodowski

 

Adam Brodowski comes from a background of consulting and most recently was the Design Director for Made by Many NYC

Website

Jacob Heftmann

 

Jacob Heftmann is a self-taught graphic designer and developer, and the principal of a design studio called XXIX (named for the year he decided to work for himself)

His professional interests are focused on the following areas: (1) building a modern graphic design practice; (2) developing better tools and processes for producing good work; (3) supporting designers in pursuing non-commercial projects; (4) multi-disciplinary design education.

Website

Erica Heinz

 

Erica Heinz has over a decade of experience in web design and development, working with both large corporations and lean startups. She manages projects from strategy and IA all the way through to development and support, pulling in outside specialists as needed.

She is schooled in visual communications, trained in Lean UX and agile development, and fascinated by the culture-changing power of the web.

Website

Nick Schaden

 

Nick Schaden is a technologist, part designer, part developer, entirely focused on generating clean, modern code on projects he loves. For now he’s assisting a rapidly expanding, popular payments service out of San Francisco.

Website

Brian Watterson

 

Brian Watterson is full of mystery.

Website
